perturbation.original_text: CERES will pay all such invoices within thirty  (30) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: CERES will pay all such invoices within ninety (90) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: Many jurisdictions have laws regarding prompt payment, and while 30 days might be standard, extending it to 90 days introduces a legal contradiction if it violates local prompt payment laws applicable to the type of services or goods being invoiced.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party will notify the other Party, in writing ("INVENTION NOTICE"), within thirty (30) days of reduction to practice or knowledge of  conception or discovery of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, and each INVENTION NOTICE will describe the JOINT INTELLECTUAL  PROPERTY with sufficient specificity to allow assessment by the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will notify the other Party, in writing ("INVENTION NOTICE"), within ten (10) days of reduction to practice or knowledge of  conception or discovery of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, and each INVENTION NOTICE will describe the JOINT INTELLECTUAL  PROPERTY with sufficient specificity to allow assessment by the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period to 10 days is a legal contradiction because it might be insufficient time, conflicting with standard business practice laws, for a thorough assessment of the intellectual property, potentially impacting the other party's ability to protect their interests.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard Business Practice Laws and Intellectual Property Assessment Requirements

perturbation.original_text: From receipt to five (5) years after the disclosure of the relevant CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration, or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement, and/or disclose any Confidential  Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the  other Party, or the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during the performance of this Agreement,  excepting that information described in Article 10.3.
perturbation.changed_text: From receipt to one (1) year after the disclosure of the relevant CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration, or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement, and/or disclose any Confidential  Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the  other Party, or the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during the performance of this Agreement,  excepting that information described in Article 10.3.
perturbation.explanation: Confidentiality agreements typically extend beyond one year. Reducing this period conflicts with what would be considered reasonable and customary for protecting trade secrets and proprietary information, potentially violating implied laws or regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Laws and Customary Business Practice Regulations
